Given all the uncertainty we are all facing I wanted to make sure that if we HAD to get somewhere in a hurry we COULD so I decided to try and get someone to come out and replace it. \n\nQuick internet search came up with RepairSmith and after a slight SNAFU with the app on the phone I got ahold of someone over the phone, got a fast quote that was less than the dealer was going to charge and an appointment the next day.  \n\nThomas came out with a replacement swapped it out, tested the battery and headed out, all in record time.  Unfortunately I was too busy to double check the error messages before he left, but then noticed that there was a new 'charging system error'.  Taking another look under the hood I found that it looked like the wiring harness that we'd both agreed wasn't attached to anything (truck is used, purchased from the dealer) was likely the culprit.\n\nCalled RepairSmith back towards the end of the day, they said they'd send Thomas back out tomorrow.  Truck was still starting, just with the error, and I wasn't planning on going anywhere so that was fine with me.\n\nThomas returned the next day and took a look at it.  Sure enough he found that the seemingly unused wire harness had a ghetto wire splice in the middle for a lead to the positive terminal on the battery.  We assumed it was for checking the differential across the battery and was the source of the aforementioned 'charging system error'.  \n\nThomas stripped the wire harness, found the errant lead, respliced it and BAM! Good to go, no 'charging system error', new, tested battery and a happy alternator (the other thing I was concerned about).\n\nReally appreciated everyone's politeness, professionalism and expertise.     window.yelp.critical_css_onload = function (id) {

            <script>(function (d, w) {
    var supportsSVG = (
        !!d.createElementNS &&
        !!d.createElementNS(
            'http://www.w3.org/2000/svg',
            'svg'
        ).createSVGRect
    );
    var cdnPath = 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/svg_icons/a35cb455e491/assets/svg_sprite.js';
    var head = d.getElementsByTagName('head')[0];
    function fallback() {
        var link = d.createElement('link');
        link.rel = 'stylesheet';
        link.href = 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/svg_icons/3bea512e5a3d/assets/sprite.css';
        head.appendChild(link);
    }
    if (!supportsSVG) {
        fallback();
        return;
    }
    if (!w.yelp) {
        w.yelp = {};
    }
    w.yelp.__injectSvgSpritesheet = function (svg) {
        document.body.insertAdjacentHTML('afterbegin', svg);
        delete window.yelp.__injectSvgSpritesheet;
    }
    function onError() {
        d.documentElement.className = [
            d.documentElement.className,
            'icon-svg-unavailable'
        ].join(' ');
        fallback();
        return true;
    }
    var script = d.createElement('script');
    script.async = true;
    script.onerror = onError;
    script.src = cdnPath + '?callback=window.yelp.__injectSvgSpritesheet';
    head.appendChild(script);
}(document, window));</script>

        <p itemprop="description">TDLR: 
Thomas was my mechanic and he was stellar. Not only was he as thorough as possible when verifying potential issues, he patiently explained the process and taught me so much about my car with a positive attitude. Would highly recommend!

Longer version:
I was driving when suddenly my car stalled and stopped in the middle of the road. It&#39;s 20 years old, so it was possible that there were many things that could be faulty. I found RepairSmith after looking up mobile mechanics and decided to make a diagnosis appointment.

- Thomas was very thorough and transparent which made it easy to trust that I was getting the right part fixed.
- He patiently explained and demonstrated how he was testing each part, what the part does, and why it might be the issue.
- The original appointment was 2 hours, but the issue wasn&#39;t clear by the end of it, so he extended it to be certain of the diagnosis before recommending a repair.
- He had a really positive attitude the entire time.
- He didn&#39;t try to up-sell me on anything, something I immensely appreciated. I know basically nothing about cars and it&#39;s very obvious, which makes me prime scamming material.
- I had to leave car in the ground floor of my garage since I only managed to get it pushed there, and it actually got broken into between appointments. He went above and beyond and took the time to help me wipe down and clean the interior of my car.
- I feel very fortunate to have found a mechanic whom I can trust to be honest and meticulous.<p>
    </div>

            <div itemprop="review" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
        <meta itemprop="author" content="Curtis L.">
        <div itemprop="reviewRating" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating">
            <meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5.0">
        </div>
        <meta itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-05-20">
        <p itemprop="description">I give the idea 5 stars. Overall it&#39;s a great idea for a mobile mechanic to come by your house. It&#39;s totally convenient. Why not? You can order almost everything else on an app.

I give Sal the brake technician 5 stars. He was very professional and a pretty nice guy. He explained everything to me. No pressure. Went over the work order, etc. Got the work done in a reasonable amount of time. He seemed pretty knowledgeable about brakes. 

I would say the only problem is not with the actual work but the booking and estimates. I give that 4 stars. Between yelp and calling them directly I have two different estimates and got conflicting schedules when my appointment was getting booked to do the work. And they left off the cleaning of the rear brakes on the final work order. But Sal promised a $25 discount for all the run-around.

Watch out though when you get your estimates. The wording is a little odd on the quote, but it does *not* include tax.<p>
    </div>

I can&#39;t recommend it here guys enough.  I&#39;m having all of my vehicles serviced by them going forward.  It&#39;s a no brained!  

Excellent value, timing &amp; communication.  I&#39;m so glad I found them!  Thank You Izzy for all your hard work!

        <p itemprop="description">Best experience ever! 
At first I was a little bit nervous to use this service, but then I saw them on TV and they have a good upfront pricing and appointment dates. I booked for the first time with Sal to repalce my Audi A8&#39;s driver cv alex. 
Pros:

            <div itemprop="review" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
        <meta itemprop="author" content="Paulie G.">
        <div itemprop="reviewRating" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating">
            <meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5.0">
        </div>
        <meta itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-04-06">
        <p itemprop="description">Our used truck has been giving us grief about the low charge on our starter battery for a couple of months now.   Given all the uncertainty we are all facing I wanted to make sure that if we HAD to get somewhere in a hurry we COULD so I decided to try and get someone to come out and replace it. 

Quick internet search came up with RepairSmith and after a slight SNAFU with the app on the phone I got ahold of someone over the phone, got a fast quote that was less than the dealer was going to charge and an appointment the next day.  

Thomas came out with a replacement swapped it out, tested the battery and headed out, all in record time.  Unfortunately I was too busy to double check the error messages before he left, but then noticed that there was a new &#39;charging system error&#39;.  Taking another look under the hood I found that it looked like the wiring harness that we&#39;d both agreed wasn&#39;t attached to anything (truck is used, purchased from the dealer) was likely the culprit.

Called RepairSmith back towards the end of the day, they said they&#39;d send Thomas back out tomorrow.  Truck was still starting, just with the error, and I wasn&#39;t planning on going anywhere so that was fine with me.

Thomas returned the next day and took a look at it.  Sure enough he found that the seemingly unused wire harness had a ghetto wire splice in the middle for a lead to the positive terminal on the battery.  We assumed it was for checking the differential across the battery and was the source of the aforementioned &#39;charging system error&#39;.  

Thomas stripped the wire harness, found the errant lead, respliced it and BAM! Good to go, no &#39;charging system error&#39;, new, tested battery and a happy alternator (the other thing I was concerned about).

Really appreciated everyone&#39;s politeness, professionalism and expertise.  Definitely would use again, especially in these wild times we all find ourselves in.

Thanks Thomas!<p>
    </div>

So I had my brakes changed with aftermarket ceramics and it was super easy. No having to drop my car off or pick it up from my local mechanic. Plus the quote was several hundred dollars cheaper so I took the plunge. No regrets yet! Will update if anything changes but great job so far!<p>

lang="en">TDLR: <br>Thomas was my mechanic and he was stellar. Not only was he as thorough as possible when verifying potential issues, he patiently explained the process and taught me so much about my car with a positive attitude. Would highly recommend!<br><br>Longer version:<br>I was driving when suddenly my car stalled and stopped in the middle of the road. It&#39;s 20 years old, so it was possible that there were many things that could be faulty. I found RepairSmith after looking up mobile mechanics and decided to make a diagnosis appointment.<br><br>- Thomas was very thorough and transparent which made it easy to trust that I was getting the right part fixed.<br>- He patiently explained and demonstrated how he was testing each part, what the part does, and why it might be the issue.<br>- The original appointment was 2 hours, but the issue wasn&#39;t clear by the end of it, so he extended it to be certain of the diagnosis before recommending a repair.<br>- He had a really positive attitude the entire time.<br>- He didn&#39;t try to up-sell me on anything, something I immensely appreciated. I know basically nothing about cars and it&#39;s very obvious, which makes me prime scamming material.<br>- I had to leave car in the ground floor of my garage since I only managed to get it pushed there, and it actually got broken into between appointments. He went above and beyond and took the time to help me wipe down and clean the interior of my car.<br>- I feel very fortunate to have found a mechanic whom I can trust to be honest and meticulous.</span></p></div><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc arrange__373c0__2C9bH vertical-align-middle__373c0__1SDTo border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc lang="en">I give the idea 5 stars. Overall it&#39;s a great idea for a mobile mechanic to come by your house. It&#39;s totally convenient. Why not? You can order almost everything else on an app.<br><br>I give Sal the brake technician 5 stars. He was very professional and a pretty nice guy. He explained everything to me. No pressure. Went over the work order, etc. Got the work done in a reasonable amount of time. He seemed pretty knowledgeable about brakes. <br><br>I would say the only problem is not with the actual work but the booking and estimates. I give that 4 stars. Between yelp and calling them directly I have two different estimates and got conflicting schedules when my appointment was getting booked to do the work. And they left off the cleaning of the rear brakes on the final work order. But Sal promised a $25 discount for all the run-around.<br><br>Watch out though when you get your estimates. The wording is a little odd on the quote, but it does *not* include tax.</span></p></div><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc arrange__373c0__2C9bH vertical-align-middle__373c0__1SDTo text__373c0__2Kxyz comment__373c0__3EKjH truncated__373c0__2tDRn text-color--normal__373c0__3xep9 text-align--left__373c0__2XGa-"><span class="lemon--span__373c0__3997G raw__373c0__3rKqk" lang="en">I have never been so disappointed and frustrated with a car service before.<br><br>2 weeks ago, I called to schedule an appointment for October 29th at 9am and the guy (Stefan) on the phone took down my address, car make, model, and all the information needed. The day after, I called to confirm that the appointment was still happening and he told me &#34;you&#39;re all set and ready to go for October 29 at 9am&#34; so I figured everything was running smoothly.<br><br>On October 29, I called at 8:38 to see if they were arriving to my house on time and the guy who picked up (Chase) told me they never had a ticket for me so they weren&#39;t going to be here at 9. He ended up re-scheduling me for a slot between 2-4pm with an estimate that they would be here at 3pm. At 2:50 they texted me saying their tech was held up and would be here later. Fine. But by 4:15 and not hearing anything from them, I ended up calling them and they said they would reach out and call back but after waiting a while I had to call them again and they were like &#34;you didnt receive a call? We weren&#39;t able to get a hold of the tech&#34;... how do you just lose track of your tech? Either way they re-scheduled me for Saturday so we shall see if they actually show up.<br><br>Chase offered a discount for all the trouble that day but then I didn&#39;t see it reflected in my account so the next day I called to follow up and they said they would send it. Trenda texted me saying they would apply a $25 discount to my account but I never saw it reflected in my invoice. So I called today and they told me I couldn&#39;t combine it with the promo code I already had.<br><br>I am absolutely livid. This kind of service is absolutely appalling and straight up unacceptable. You wasted my and my bfs entire day on Tuesday waiting for you guys, then offer me the same $25 discount which I can already find online (which is actually pretty insulting), and now after following up/calling multiple times to update my invoice for days you tell me that I can&#39;t combine it with the online offer? Straight up ridiculous.<br><br>I feel like they say things to make you happy while you&#39;re on the phone so they can hang up asap but they don&#39;t take any action afterwards. They just leave notes for each other and none of them read it or do anything about it.<br><br>I&#39;ll update this review if/when they show up on Saturday 8am for my car service. I hope their tech is not as bad as their customer support is.</span></p></div><a class="lemon--a__373c0__IEZFH link__373c0__1G70M link-color--blue-dark__373c0__85-Nu link-size--default__373c0__7tls6" class="lemon--p__373c0__3Qnnj text__373c0__2Kxyz comment__373c0__3EKjH text-color--normal__373c0__3xep9 text-align--left__373c0__2XGa-"><span class="lemon--span__373c0__3997G raw__373c0__3rKqk" lang="en">My car finally encountered its first check engine light after 18 years and 2 owners. Thomas was incredibly patient in explaining what was going on with my car and even took the time to teach me how to care for it on my own in the future. Because he was so thorough and honest about the issues coming up during the inspection, the recommended repairs were well within reason. He took into account of my budget and detailed which fixes were an immediate priority for safety reasons. 5 stars is not enough for Thomas, as he exceeded all my expectations. Super knowledgeable, passionate about cars, and overall a pretty cool individual to talk to.<br><br>RepairSmith has been great with making appointments and rescheduling if needed. They are also quick to respond to inquiries via multiple communication channels. It seemed too good to be true to have a mechanic go to you vs having to tow your car to an autoshop. The fees are clearly listed and are collected after services are rendered, not before.</span></p></div><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc arrange__373c0__2C9bH vertical-align-middle__373c0__1SDTo No matter what obstacles that seemed to get in our way, he never let me feel let down and did anything it took to get the job done right, and right away. Don&#39;t ever lose him because coming from the world of customer service myself, his was nothing short of amazing, and that&#39;s talent that&#39;s hard to find. Thank you again Sal. class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc padding-t0-5__373c0__3Uxzj padding-r0-5__373c0__jk778 padding-b0-5__373c0__2VKsH padding-l0-5__373c0__3fXBk border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><p class="lemon--p__373c0__3Qnnj text__373c0__2Kxyz text-color--blue-dark__373c0__1jX7S text-align--left__373c0__2XGa- text-weight--bold__373c0__1elNz text-size--small__373c0__3NVWO">Embed border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc margin-t1__373c0__oLmO6 margin-b1__373c0__1khoT border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc arrange__373c0__2C9bH gutter-1__373c0__2l5bx vertical-align-middle__373c0__1SDTo border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc arrange-unit__373c0__o3tjT border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><span class="lemon--span__373c0__3997G display--inline__373c0__3JqBP border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc i-stars__373c0__1BRrc i-stars--regular-5__373c0__1P0Eg border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU overflow--hidden__373c0__2y4YK" aria-label="5 star rating" role="img"><img class="lemon--img__373c0__3GQUb offscreen__373c0__1KofL" src="https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/public/stars_v2.yelp_design_web.yji-52d3d7a328db670d4402843cbddeed89.png" width="132" height="560" alt=""/></div></span></div><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc arrange-unit__373c0__o3tjT arrange-unit-fill__373c0__3Sfw1 border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><span class="lemon--span__373c0__3997G text__373c0__2Kxyz text-color--mid__373c0__jCeOG text-align--left__373c0__2XGa-">4/6/2020</span></div></div></div><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc margin-b2__373c0__abANL border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><p class="lemon--p__373c0__3Qnnj text__373c0__2Kxyz comment__373c0__3EKjH text-color--normal__373c0__3xep9 text-align--left__373c0__2XGa-"><span class="lemon--span__373c0__3997G raw__373c0__3rKqk" lang="en">Our used truck has been giving us grief about the low charge on our starter battery for a couple of months now.   Given all the uncertainty we are all facing I wanted to make sure that if we HAD to get somewhere in a hurry we COULD so I decided to try and get someone to come out and replace it. <br><br>Quick internet search came up with RepairSmith and after a slight SNAFU with the app on the phone I got ahold of someone over the phone, got a fast quote that was less than the dealer was going to charge and an appointment the next day.  <br><br>Thomas came out with a replacement swapped it out, tested the battery and headed out, all in record time.  Unfortunately I was too busy to double check the error messages before he left, but then noticed that there was a new &#39;charging system error&#39;.  Taking another look under the hood I found that it looked like the wiring harness that we&#39;d both agreed wasn&#39;t attached to anything (truck is used, purchased from the dealer) was likely the culprit.<br><br>Called RepairSmith back towards the end of the day, they said they&#39;d send Thomas back out tomorrow.  Truck was still starting, just with the error, and I wasn&#39;t planning on going anywhere so that was fine with me.<br><br>Thomas returned the next day and took a look at it.  Sure enough he found that the seemingly unused wire harness had a ghetto wire splice in the middle for a lead to the positive terminal on the battery.  We assumed it was for checking the differential across the battery and was the source of the aforementioned &#39;charging system error&#39;.  <br><br>Thomas stripped the wire harness, found the errant lead, respliced it and BAM! Good to go, no &#39;charging system error&#39;, new, tested battery and a happy alternator (the other thing I was concerned about).<br><br>Really appreciated everyone&#39;s politeness, professionalism and expertise.  Definitely would use again, especially in these wild times we all find ourselves in.<br><br>Thanks Thomas!</span></p></div><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc arrange__373c0__2C9bH class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc arrange-unit__373c0__o3tjT arrange-unit-fill__373c0__3Sfw1 border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><span class="lemon--span__373c0__3997G text__373c0__2Kxyz text-color--mid__373c0__jCeOG text-align--left__373c0__2XGa-">2/29/2020</span></div></div></div><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc margin-b2__373c0__abANL border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><p class="lemon--p__373c0__3Qnnj text__373c0__2Kxyz comment__373c0__3EKjH text-color--normal__373c0__3xep9 text-align--left__373c0__2XGa-"><span class="lemon--span__373c0__3997G raw__373c0__3rKqk" lang="en">Izzy and Tom were great. Izzy has 10 years of experience and Tom used to be a shop manager at Mercedes Benz. So these guys are experienced. <br><br>Tom came by and started work on my brakes but got hurt when one of my wheels was stuck and hit him on the knee when it yanked free. Repairsmith immediately sent a replacement guy, Izzy, while Tom went to get his knee looked at by a doctor.   Izzy was super knowledgeable and took over. He finished the job in a few hours. So I had my brakes changed with aftermarket ceramics and it was super easy. No having to drop my car off or pick it up from my local mechanic. Plus the quote was several hundred dollars cheaper so I took the plunge. No regrets yet! Will update if anything changes but great job so far!</span></p></div><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc arrange__373c0__2C9bH vertical-align-middle__373c0__1SDTo 30, 2020","type":"photo","id":"OiCfS6pUP1tVWo0AbWEYSA"}],"id":"BOiSK7WclBplGpxTDVE0QQ","localizedDate":"1/30/2020"},{"comment":{"text":"Our used truck has been giving us grief about the low charge on our starter battery for a couple of months now.   Given all the uncertainty we are all facing I wanted to make sure that if we HAD to get somewhere in a hurry we COULD so I decided to try and get someone to come out and replace it. <br&gt;<br&gt;Quick internet search came up with RepairSmith and after a slight SNAFU with the app on the phone I got ahold of someone over the phone, got a fast quote that was less than the dealer was going to charge and an appointment the next day.  <br&gt;<br&gt;Thomas came out with a replacement swapped it out, tested the battery and headed out, all in record time.  Unfortunately I was too busy to double check the error messages before he left, but then noticed that there was a new &amp;#39;charging system error&amp;#39;.  Taking another look under the hood I found that it looked like the wiring harness that we&amp;#39;d both agreed wasn&amp;#39;t attached to anything (truck is used, purchased from the dealer) was likely the culprit.<br&gt;<br&gt;Called RepairSmith back towards the end of the day, they said they&amp;#39;d send Thomas back out tomorrow.  Truck was still starting, just with the error, and I wasn&amp;#39;t planning on going anywhere so that was fine with me.<br&gt;<br&gt;Thomas returned the next day and took a look at it.  Sure enough he found that the seemingly unused wire harness had a ghetto wire splice in the middle for a lead to the positive terminal on the battery.  We assumed it was for checking the differential across the battery and was the source of the aforementioned &amp;#39;charging system error&amp;#39;.  <br&gt;<br&gt;Thomas stripped the wire harness, found the errant lead, respliced it and BAM!
